creator: john.bischoff

title: How do I "save page as" or use Ctl+S without a dialogue popping up?
content:
How do I "save page as" or use Ctl+S without a dialogue popping up?

I use linux. I am running updated tor browser (a fork of firefox). I can not use extensions. I can not switch browsers.

My goal is to quickly and without distractions download the web page in a way that I can read later the page later, even when I am offline. If this is not possible with the "save page as" dialogue, any suggestions that would help me achieve this goal would be greatly appreciated.

My preference would be to use the "print page as" option, but I have been unable to get it to work, even with an about.config flag that I found to disable the dioglogue. with that flag enabled it does not rename the file, and thus simply wont work if there is already a downloaded pdf.

creator: beth.barham5

title: Unable to log in to Simplifimoney.com on desktop & laptop
content:
I am using Simplifi by Quicken as my bookkeeping software on my Windows 10 desktop and laptop. Recently, I have been unable to log in. Each time, the log in page says 'invalid credentials.' This occurs in FF, as well as Edge and the Simplifi app on my desktop.

Quicken's tech advised me "We strongly advise double-checking if there is no VPN activated in the network nor any security setting active in your PC. As long as there is no VPN or security setting activated, you will be able to access, just like you are in your mobile app." I do not have a VPN on any of my devices and I have not been able to find any security setting that would cause this problem.

I followed [https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/fix-login-issues-on-websites-require...] these instructions, but nothing changed.

When I went into troubleshooting mode I was able to log in successfully.

I should note that I also had the same issue using the Librewolf variant of FF, as well as Edge. However, I was able to log in using Chrome and the Simplifi Android app.

I'm hoping someone with more knowledge than me can shed some light on what's going on.

Cheerss
creator: Steve2526

title: marcadores se guardan por url no por nombre
content: hola consulta, tengo varias series "agendadas" en los marcadores de FF, cuando se actualiza un capitulo, yo arrastraba la url a la barra de marcadores y quedaba con este formato aRGENTeaM . ted Lasso (2020) [S03E01] ahora queda con este formato https://argenteam.net/episode/145695/Te ... 3E05-Signs, probe en edge, y lo guarda bien, inicie con los complementps desactivados y lo sigue guardando la url nop el nombre del marcador
creator: MarceloTDF

title: After yesterday my youtube search button isn't working anymore on mouseclick
content:
Hey all,

I have a very weird problem after yesterday.

So I was on Youtube and I pressed the search button and a pop-up came from Firefox. I don't know anymore what it was and I just clicked on something. After that my Youtube search button is't working anymore when I click it with my mouse. When I enter a text and press my enter button it still works.

When I go to another browser or use Firefox Incognito mode it also works. When I log out of my account, it works. When I use a new profile it works.

So I installed Firefox and reinstalled it again. Installed my add-ons again and tested it again. And it worked again. But from the moment when I logon on Youtube website with Firefox it DOESN'T work anymore.

This simply drives me crazy lol. So it works on 99% of the time only when I use Firefox on my account even with a new profile my search button doesn't work again.

Could this be a Firefox setting within the Youtube website or a Firefox permission thing which isn't carried over from a new profile?

I don't know how on earth I could fix this issue and I'm hoping someone here could help me with the setting inside Firefox that could make my Youtube search button work again on my left mouse click.

Thanks in advance.
creator: Focusstman

title: Extreme memory usage (working set)
content:
Hello, ever since I upgraded to version 112 I've noticed that Firefox is using up a lot of my ram. I currently have 32 GB installed, Firefox is using almost all of it making other Programs almost unusable. Because of this I now have to restart Firefox, but this is only a temporary fix

In task manager it shows that its only using ~1.6 GB (which is normal) but overall usage is at 90%, in process explorer it shows that Firefox is taking up 30 GB

To troubleshoot I've looked at both about:performance and about:memory but nothing looks out of the ordinary, they just show a normal usage. Clicking on "minimize memory usage" didn't do anything. Restarting my computer also didn't help

I've attached some screenshots


Thank you in advance
creator: IstAuchEgal

title: All firefox windows freeze for 10 seconds whenever I middle-click a link
content:
This happens only when middle-clicking links, but not right-clicking and opening them in a new tab. It also doesn't happen when I middle-click a tab to close it.

I'm using Firefox 112 on a KDE plasma archlinux session using wayland, the system is all up to date.

I've recorded a profile of the ~10 seconds while the UI is frozen: https://share.firefox.dev/41wL4Na

While inspecting it it looks like it wait for exactly 9 seconds in a call to retrieve clipboard contents, but that's just what it looks like and I could be wrong, hope it helps!

(příklad: mam otevřený prohlížeč Firefox s deseti aktivními záložkami – panely na téma sport, toto bych chtěl uložit, druhy den mám otevřených pět záložek na téma zahrada, též toto bych chtěl někam uložit, než počítač vypnu). Příští den po novem spuštěni počítače bych chtěl vyvolat jedno z těchto zapamatovaných témat, tzn. aby se najednou otevřely všechny záložky na zvolené téma. Děkuji

title: Firefox search suggestions in Google
content:
If I start entering a search word in the FF address bar it brings up FF suggestions based on my prior searching.

If I enter “Google.com”, a new screen opens & shows a Google search box in the center. If I start entering a search word it brings up Google’s suggestions. But it used to bring up the Firefox suggestions followed by the Google suggestions. IOW both. This function stopped working about when Firefox updated about a week ago.

This is how it used to look. I tried changing all the usual settings but to avail. Any suggestions how to bring this back? Thanks

title: Firefox creates almost 200 processes on exit, 100% CPU
content:
Hello,

When I close Firefox after the last update (current installed version: 112.0 x64 Windows 10), Firefox creates almost 200 processes (in the latest case 177), each using from 17 MB to 65 MB RAM (except one that is using over 200 MB - I guess the main one) using 100% CPU for about half a minute, and in that my PC is unusable - everything hangs. It takes a bit more time to close all of them.

Any ideas what could be wrong and how to fix it?

Thank you.

title: WordPress plugin bugs in Firefox
content: Good morning My name is Manel, and I am a Firefox user, since its inception. I have a WordPress page that works perfectly in Opera, Edge, Safari, etc., but in Firefox, some plugins I'm using don't work, specifically this plugin is called Complianz, it's a cookie manager. The most curious thing is that from the frontend, it looks and works, but when I exit the frontend and run the page, the cookie warning does not appear. On the other hand, with Firefox on Android, there is no plugin problem, they work fine, it only happens to me with the PC. I am attaching two screenshots, one with the web page where the plugin does not appear and the other with the frontend, where it does appear, I have marked it in green. Any solution? Thank you.

title: Error try to accessing a certain website
content:
I am trying to access PDB (Protein Data Bank) but the followinf error keeps appearing:

Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to www.rcsb.org. PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR

Error code: PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.


Note that I have 2 laptops, one macbook and one linux. This error appears when I try to access the website from my mac, but doesn't on my linux or my phone. Also, keep in mind that I already tried uninstall Firefox, delete cookis and data or even try another browser (Safari & Chrome), but nothing worked. Also, I have the latest version of Firefox (112.0).

title: Deleted firefox account, secondary email is still in use
content:
I had a Firefox account with a primary and a secondary email address. A couple weeks ago I decide to delete this account using the Delete Account in the Firefox profile page (accounts.firefox.com -> settings -> profile -> Delete account button at the bottom). Then, I wanted to create a new profile with the secondary email address from the former (now is deleted) account. Surprisingly accounts.firefox.com thinks that the secondary email still in use, because I can't register with it. Even if I create a new account with some email, and I try to add the secondary email as secondary email, I get the error message, that "This email was already confirmed by another user". Which is not possible since I deleted the account.

So, what can I do?

This is very irritating - especially for 2 step verification.
